abstract: Mr. Schultz is planning to leave the job in April, turning the reins over to his handpicked successor, Kevin Johnson.
snippet: Mr. Schultz is planning to leave the job in April, turning the reins over to his handpicked successor, Kevin Johnson.
lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Howard Schultz, the visionary leader of Starbucks, said on Thursday he would step down as chief executive next year, handing over to his personally selected successor the management of the company he built into the world’s largest coffee business, with over 25,000 stores in 75 countries.

headline.main: Howard Schultz to Step Down as Starbucks Chief Next Year
headline.print_headline: Visionary Behind Starbucks to Step Aside
